column2: all-trans-Retinol, Retinals, and alternative provitamin A-functioning Carotenoids including all-trans-beta-carotene
column7: from animal origin as Vitamin A / all-trans-Retinol: Fish in general, liver and dairy products; from plant origin as provitamin A / all-trans-beta-carotene: orange, ripe yellow fruits, leafy vegetables, carrots, pumpkin, squash, spinach;
Pork, wholemeal grains, brown rice, vegetables, potatoes, liver, eggs
Dairy products, bananas, green beans, asparagus
Meat, fish, eggs, many vegetables, mushrooms, tree nuts

column6: Impairment of proprioception, nerve damage (doses > 100 mg/day)

column7: Raw egg yolk, liver, peanuts, leafy green vegetables

column5: Megaloblastic anemia and deficiency during pregnancy is associated with birth defects, such as neural tube defects
column6: May mask symptoms of vitamin B12 deficiency; other effects.
column7: Leafy vegetables, pasta, bread, cereal, liver
Lichen, eggs, liver, certain fish species such as sardines, certain mushroom species such as shiitake

column5: Deficiency is very rare; mild hemolytic anemia in newborn infants[20]
column6: Possible increased incidence of congestive heart failure.[21][22]
column7: Many fruits and vegetables, nuts and seeds, and seed oils
Leafy green vegetables such as spinach; egg yolks; liver
